images.caption:
Rešovské waterfalls – view of the lower part of the cascade with blocks of metavolcanic rocks in the riverbed of the Huntava river
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Rešovské waterfalls – the main cascade of the waterfall. Its rock level and right bank wall consists of quartz keratophyres
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Rešovské waterfalls – smaller cascades in the riverbed of the Huntava river above the main level of the waterfall
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Near the Rešovské waterfalls – brashed-in opening of an old, manually tunnelled iron ore drift
Photo by P. Rozsíval
